Class Percolation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Percolation

  • public class Percolation
extends Object
    The Percolation class represents a data type for modelling percolation system as defined at Programming Assignment 1: Percolation

    Percolation class is implemented using WeightedQuickUnionUF class. Each site in the n * n grid is represented on the WeightedQuickUnionUF by an index. Two additional elements are added to the array to represent

    • Top row site - Site connected to all top row sites.
    • Bottom row site - Site connected to all bottom row sites.
    This enables us check if the system is percolation by just checking if the Top row site is connected to the Bottom row site .
    Author:
    Ashutosh Grewal
    See Also:
    Checklist: Percolation This implementation suffers from the backwash problem described in the FAQ section of the checklist.

      • Percolation

        public Percolation(int n)
        Initialize the fields in the Percolation class including creating a weighted quick union-find data type to remember the connected Open sites.
        Parameters:

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public void open(int row,
                 int col)
        Mark a particular site open in the grid. When the site is opened, it is connected to all the open neighboring sites to the left, right, upward or downward direction.

        We also keep track of the # of open sites in this method.

        Parameters:
        row - The row this site is located in.
        col - The column this site is located at.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if (row <= 0 || row > rowColSize) or (col <= 0 || col > rowColSize).

      • isOpen

        public boolean isOpen(int row,
                      int col)
        Check if a particular site is open.
        Parameters:
        row - The this site is located in.
        col - The column this site is located at.
        Returns:
        True if the site is open, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if (row <= 0 || row > rowColSize) or (col <= 0 || col > rowColSize).

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull(int row,
                      int col)
        Check if a particular site is open and reachable from any of the sites from the top.
        Parameters:
        row - The this site is located in.
        col - The column this site is located at.
        Returns:
        True if the site is open and connected to one of the top sites, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if row <= 0 || row > rowColSize) or (col <= 0 || col > rowColSize).
